abstract: Commerce Dept reports new single-family home sales increased 5.4 percent in July to seasonally adjusted annual rate of 507,000 units, up 25.8 percent from same month year earlier; Conference Board reports consumer confidence index of 101.5 in August, seven-month high.
lead_paragraph: Sales increased 5.4 percent to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 507,000 units, the Commerce Department said. Those sales account for 8.3 percent of the market.
snippet: Sales increased 5.4 percent to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 507,000 units, the Commerce Department said. Those sales account for 8.3 percent of the market.

keywords.value: Standard & Poor's Case-Shiller Home Price Index
